result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Pfeiffer

records.addlTxt:
9:01 AM Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for David A Pfeiffer.  Attorney appears by authorization. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense makes arguments in support of request to requests that the Court remove the Level 2 supervision at Justice Point (WCS monitoring).
State makes arguments in opposition to any modification of bond. 
For reasons stated on the record, the court declines the Motion to modify bond. 

Defense has received discovery, but indicates that charging DA requested more time for investigation. Requests date in 30-45 days. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 10/14/2022 received and filed.

9:13 AM Defendant David A Pfeiffer in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for David A Pfeiffer.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense filed a bail motion today. Defense has provided reports from investigator to the State and requests for another date, and request to set bail motion for same date. Court sets bail motion.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty Singleton
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Singleton appears on behalf of the Defendant

Adjustment Number: 22A 036002,
Payable Number: 475143,
Receipt Number: 22R 039346,
Amount: $20.00

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with alcohol monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  Alcohol monitoring and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with any alcohol monitoring and drug testing. The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day.

10:45 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant David A Pfeiffer in court.   Victim A appeared in court.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. The Defendant states he has retained attorney Singleton. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 08/25/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
